sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: RESINA a town of Italy, 6 miles south-east of Naples and practically a southern continuation of Portici, is well known as the usual starting place for tourists on their way up Vesuvius, and as the nearest town to the buried city of Herculaneum. It had 13,626 inhabitants in 1881 (commune 15,593).
